title: Documentation
subtitle: Learn how to build structured AI APIs with {{appName}}

seo.gettingStarted: Learn how to get started with {{appName}}. Create projects, configure LLM providers, and build your first structured AI endpoint.
seo.concepts: Understand core concepts: endpoints, JSON schemas, system context, and organization paths for building structured AI APIs.
seo.apiReference: Complete API reference for {{appName}}. REST endpoints, request formats, response structures, and code examples.
seo.default: {{appName}} documentation. Learn how to build reliable AI-powered REST APIs with JSON Schema validation.

howTo.name: How to Create a Structured LLM Endpoint
howTo.description: Step-by-step guide to creating your first structured AI API endpoint with {{appName}}

createProject.name: Create a Project
createProject.text: Start by creating a new project in your dashboard to organize your endpoints.

addProvider.name: Add an LLM Provider
addProvider.text: Configure your API key for OpenAI, Anthropic, Google Gemini, or a custom LM server.

defineEndpoint.name: Define an Endpoint
defineEndpoint.text: Create an endpoint with instructions, context, and JSON output schema.

testEndpoint.name: Test Your Endpoint
testEndpoint.text: Use the built-in tester to verify your endpoint returns structured data.

integrate.name: Integrate
integrate.text: Call your endpoint from your application using simple GET or POST requests.

steps.title: Create a Project
steps.description: Start by creating a new project in your dashboard. Give it a name and optional description.

steps.title: Add a Provider
steps.description: Configure your API key for OpenAI, Anthropic, Google Gemini, or a custom LM server.

steps.title: Define an Endpoint
steps.description: Create an endpoint with output JSON schema, instructions, and context. Connect it to your LLM key.

steps.title: Set Your Organization Path
steps.description: Configure a custom organization path in settings, or use your auto-generated default path.

steps.title: Integrate
steps.description: Call your endpoint from your application using simple GET or POST requests.

items.name: Input Schema
items.description: JSON Schema defining the expected structure of input data (optional)

items.name: Output Schema
items.description: JSON Schema defining the structure of the LLM's response

items.name: Instructions
items.description: Specific instructions for what the LLM should do with the input

items.name: Context
items.description: System context/prompt to guide the LLM's behavior

items.name: HTTP Method
items.description: GET (query params) or POST (JSON body) for input data

inputSchema.title: Input Schema
inputSchema.description: Define the expected structure of input data using JSON Schema. When callers send data to your endpoint, {{appName}} validates it against your input schema before processing. This ensures your LLM receives well-formed data and provides clear error messages for invalid requests.

outputSchema.title: Output Schema
outputSchema.description: Define the structure of LLM outputs using JSON Schema. {{appName}} instructs the LLM to return data matching your schema and validates the response, automatically retrying if the output doesn't conform.

context.title: System Context
context.description: Provide system prompts to guide the LLM's behavior. This context is included with every request to your endpoint.

organizationPath.title: Organization Path
organizationPath.description: Your organization path is used in API URLs. By default, it's the first 8 characters of your user ID, but you can customize it in settings.

apiReference.title: API Reference
apiReference.description: Access your endpoints via REST API. All AI endpoints are public and don't require authentication.

main.title: Execute Endpoint
main.description: Executes the endpoint and returns the LLM response with usage metrics.

prompt.title: Get Prompt Only
prompt.description: Returns the generated prompt without calling the LLM. Useful for debugging.

response.title: Response Format
response.description: Successful responses include the LLM output and usage statistics:

fields.name: output
fields.description: The structured response from the LLM matching your output schema
